title: Is it bad to write someone else's college essay? - Quora

response.answer_text: I always believed it was bad form and against academic integrity when I was in college. Of course, a student with physical or mental impairment would require whatever accommodation they needed. In my mind, higher education isn’t designed to teach you what to learn, but how to learn. To that end, composing sound and informative essays demonstrates a student’s ability to apply how they have researched their topic and thought process. Researching a topic is a big task. Selective subtopics and critical thinking skills are imperative to writing a robust essay chock full of smooth transitions, format, facts, and appropriate citations. It’s an academic’s form of art, and I’ve had the pleasure of reading some masterpieces from my colleagues way back when. By having someone else write their essay, the student showcases their lack of learning how to learn. And remember: all rough drafts suck.

Yes, as stated in the other answer, there are really bad consequences if anyone finds out, like your (or the person’s who you wrote the essay for) admissions decision getting rescinded. It’s not fair to other students applying.
